reviews.text: Went to a stingrays game with family and friends and had a great night out. The Coliseum is perfect to watch a game  no matter where you sit. The workers could not be more helpful or friendly. The Coliseum and the Stingrays provide a great neat out for the family at a reasonable price. Can’t wAit to go back!

Love the parking, most of the people who work there are very nice (Aside from the guy who was a jerk about my camera, who held his fingers less than half an inch apart and said the lens has to be that big to bring it in. He was very patronizing and it wasn't necessary). The boards could use some new glass and it's really cold inside, so bundle up. The atmosphere is nice, though. Concessions have a pretty decent selection and the prices are fair.
Very clean and easy to get around. It's a perfect small concert venue. It's big enough for a great crowd but small enough that there are no bad seats.
It has been awhile since I can here. The upgrades are very nice. I love the sit down restaurant where the players enter and exit through the restuarant. The drinks are also refillable.

Nice facility. Great staff; parking and getting into facility off the expressway is kind of tricky especially with daily or rush hour traffic. Staff was helpful and kind. Nice event location for concert and or basketball tournament.

Nice venue.  Definitely worth the extra money for the covered seating, if you have lawn seats there is almost nowhere to hide it rains.  We saw Muse and before they came on there was a 90 minute delay for the rain.  The lawn folks got drenched unless they could squeeze under the awnings of the concession stands.

Loved the lay out! The food and drink was good and the bathrooms were well maintained and the concert was awesome! PNC was easy to get to and really wasn't hard to get out of after the concert was over.

I'm not sure that I could hate this venue more. The parking. How FAR it is outside of most of Charlotte. The traffic. The prices. Gosh, for such an up and coming city, it's so disappointing to have so many acts signing up to play here.

As soon as I saw I couldn't bring a chair, I decided not to go. Experienced the same at CMF in myrtle beach  . Chairs were $60.00 and sold out. If you are older and need back support and can't stand for long periods,   don't waste your money.  These places are all about the $ and not senior friendly.
Favorite big venue in Charlotte,  I've seen countless show and always enjoy it whether rain or shine
Our favorite place in Charlotte to catch independent releases. I've literally never seen a bad movie here. ♥️♥️♥️
A more quiet venue to see great films... generally not many children running around.  Excellent food, snacks, adult beverages...
Always showing more obscure fantastic movies here; think Sundance films. Great service and comfy clean chairs.
Very nice theatre. Reasonable matinee/senior prices. Stadium seating. Clean restrooms and pleasant staff.
Nice selection of limited-release films. Probably the best in the area. I wish they were more centrally-located, though.  It was nice being able to see those films on Park Rd
The best theater around.  Great selection of films and always offer up a great experience.  One of the most enjoyable theater experiences around.  Very lucky to have this place in Charlotte.

Gotta love this old style theater. In an era of Metroplexes with reclining seats, latte bars, and make your own nachos, this tiny art house-type theater is a nostalgic breath of yesterday. Friendly staff, simple choices at the concession stand,  restrooms with actual art, and the feel of a community theater. best of all are the films that are carried here. Though it's no longer an independent theater, they still select films that appeal to the more sophisticated film fan. So glad they've been able to stay in business despite all the competition from the big boys!

Such a cool little theater. Obviously a local place, old world experience that I think is just awesome. Right next to a bunch of food so you've got great dinner options. Staff is friendly and clearly just love movies.

First time coming here, was not disappointed. Business seems very slow but it has a very nice vibe to it. Staff was very pleasant and nice to be around. Popcorn took a few minutes because they had to make it fresh, but made up for it by adding butter with each layer of popcorn without even asking (I asked for butter). Overall, I'd really like to come back here for future movies.
I liked it. The seating was good, the crowd mature. Better than the suburbs

With being a school bus driver I come here often to bring all ages and groups to enjoy everything the children theater has to offer. With a large library, great shows and plenty of activities it's hard to get bored here.

I love this place. My daughter has gone to two semesters of acting now, thanks to their scholarship program, and I just couldn’t be happier w/ her teacher Miss. Regina! Miss Regina is a ray of sunshine and a joy to work with! She has the sweetest heart and u can tell she genuinely loves the kids!! We wish we could do the summer camps too, but even though the scholarship does cover it, the hours begin after I am work and end before I am off. There’s no way a single Mom can do that schedule. Which is my only complaint w/ them. Maybe some time they can do a summer camp for single, working Moms?? Idk, but fingers crossed
My grandson loved 'Three Little Birds'. The venue fosters the use of your imagination.  Great for children and adults alike.
This is an awesome place to visit. We went to see The Ghost of Splinter Cove. Great play.
Not a bad seat in the house. Great productions and a great place.

Lounge area and concessions greet you at the door. The theatre itself is small and intimate with a large stage and great sound. There is not a bad seat in the house. Thoroughly enjoyed our experience!

I attended this past Saturday's performance of Rock Of Ages and it was Spectacular!!!
Everything from the concessions, ushers, the band and of course the cast were engaging, entertaining and kept my foot tapping to beat non-stop. I can't wait to come back for a other performances.

Well Done, Bravo!

I laugh l cry l applaud 
I am never disappointed.
The one time  that I  went I really enjoyed it plan on attending again they are doing a great job.
Fun theater in an intimate setting. You get an up close impression of the show regardless of where you sit and the acting is always quite good.
Great location. Easy parking and great for smaller performances. I have attended many here over the years and have always been pleased.

"Ain't Misbehavin" was absolutely Amazing! Each vocalist did their thing! Wish it could be extended beyond this weekend so more would have the pleasure to experience a phenomenal performance! Kudos Everyone!!!
Small quaint and not a bad seat in the house. Small assortment of wines and simple snacks. Overall exclusive is fun for the family and at a very reasonable cost.
Enjoyable performances of " A Christmas Carol " by local theater.
Amazing shows,the smiles will make your face hurt and wouldnt trade it for anything...:)
Beautiful venue with quirks that add to the ambiance. They bring in good quality performances.
Cozy place to see your favorite musical artists

Got to teach songwriting and recording in one of the classrooms. Our band Kingcity performed and the sound staff was courteous and knowledgeable! I've experienced artist, Tommy Emmanuel here. Great show! I've seen the documentary film 'Glimpse'. Always high quality.
Really nice theater but the last rows are benches, but chairs. Hard to sit for 2+ hours.
McGlothon Theatre is great venue. been attending shows since it was Spirit Square.

One of Charlotte's best secrets is CPCC's arts plays and musical series.  Holding almost 900 people, the theatre department produces great regional level productions. Have been a annual subscriber for years.  Check out their varied offerings.  Attendees are mostly senior adults. Great value, experience and opportunity to try Charlotte's many excellent restaurants.

Great venue. The seats all seemed to have a good view of the stage and the acoustics (for our dance competition) worked well. The stage and backstage areas we utilized were roomy and user friendly as well.

Because of the quality of productions performed here and the wonderful theater atmosphere one receives as they enter, we have committed to next seasons performances in whole. This is quality Theater for the common man or woman. Thank you.

I had a great time I did not know Central Piedmont community college had an amazing theater such as this one. I definitely encourage other people to take the initiative and check it out for themselves you won't be disappointed.

Very nice theatre! Comfortable seats, nice bathrooms, big open atrium/lobby to accommodate large crowds moving around. Nice ramps and elevators for accessibility. Only complaint is the parking garage stairwells and elevators look like they haven't been cleaned in a decade plus, gross...

With being a school bus driver I come here often to bring all ages and groups to enjoy everything the children theater has to offer. With a large library, great shows and plenty of activities it's hard to get bored here.

I love this place. My daughter has gone to two semesters of acting now, thanks to their scholarship program, and I just couldn’t be happier w/ her teacher Miss. Regina! Miss Regina is a ray of sunshine and a joy to work with! She has the sweetest heart and u can tell she genuinely loves the kids!! We wish we could do the summer camps too, but even though the scholarship does cover it, the hours begin after I am work and end before I am off. There’s no way a single Mom can do that schedule. Which is my only complaint w/ them. Maybe some time they can do a summer camp for single, working Moms?? Idk, but fingers crossed
My grandson loved 'Three Little Birds'. The venue fosters the use of your imagination.  Great for children and adults alike.
This is an awesome place to visit. We went to see The Ghost of Splinter Cove. Great play.
Not a bad seat in the house. Great productions and a great place.

Are you kidding me? I called ahead for 12 people 5 of them being small kids. I had to wait another 45 minutes after the call ahead time to get seated and I repeat with 5 small children. Are you kidding me? Is the call ahead not done for that particular reason that I don’t have to spend an hour waiting for a table with small children? I don’t understand. The host not only is standing there giving me an issue but also making comments about how he can’t do anything. Perhaps you shouldn’t be making a call and head if you cannot accommodate. Disgusting! Very disappointed my last time here.

Excellent service that evening and the steaks were cooked to perfection. I strongly recommend people tell them to leave their seasoning off because it really ruins s a good piece of meat.  I loved that the sweet potato was not in foil so it was actually a sweet potato and not pudding.  The New York strip was amazingly tasty for the price. Our waiter was really on top of things and kept our glasses full and kept checking to see if we were satisfied. The salads were very fresh and tasty. I do recommend the wedge salad because it is excellent and a good value.

Wow Wow Wow. Had a great meal. Service was outstanding.  The waiter Michael was a step above all before.  We both had a special.  Lobster tail and Sirloin - and - Lobster tail and Crab Cakes and Shrimp skewer. A couple beers and the Awesome brownie.  Looking forward to going back and asking for the same waiter Michael!

I tried something new this visit and had the Pork Porterhouse. It was cooked perfectly, properly cooked and still juicy. It was very savory and I was very happy with my selection. The waiter, though he got our order correct and sufficiently attentive, while he was standing in front of our table seemed like we were keeping him from something more important. It was a typical Outback, so nothing to write home about with the decor. We were seating at the first booth from the lobby, so we saw quite a bit of foot traffic. In general, a nice meal with the delicious piece of pork being the best thing of the night.

Terrible experience yesterday. 3:45 in the afternoon and half the restaurant is empty! We were told to wait for 40 minutes until a waiter came on duty to wait on us🙄😡
So we left and went to Texas Roadhouse where we received amazing treatment with excellent customer service. 
We will not go back to Outback ever!!

I’ve been going to Brixx for years whenever I am in Charlotte. The pizzas are great and the patio is heated-which is a good thing this time of year, since the main dining room fills up fast on the weekends. 

Prices are also very reasonable.
Food was excellent. Ask about the lunch special. Personal pizza and salad for 8 bucks!

I am glad that I hit this restaurant on a Tuesday evening after a terrible day. They have good quality firewood pizzas. Most importantly Cauliflower crust pizzas are available which is a great option for low carb diet eaters. To my surprise most of the pizza base sauce was mozarilla and limited options with regular tomato base. Ambience was above average. They run beer and wine offers on each day for all days.  I would recommend it if you're a pizza lover.
Only complaint is, the dining room is a little tight for my liking. Period. Good food, great service.
First time eating here..My Daughters have eaten here before..The youngest one had dietary issues..But,she can order from their menu without any issues..

I stopped in for dinner around 7:00 and they offer table service in the evenings at this location. The service was great as was the food. The waitress was great about keeping my beverage full and regularly checked to see if I needed anything without being overbearing. I took my time eating I wasn’t in any hurry and I did some work as I ate. I was impressed that the staff never seemed to rush me or get impatient with me taking so long. I really enjoyed a nice relaxing dinner and the prices are so inexpensive.

Great place for lunch. Very friendly employees, great food, and everyone there is in such a good mood that happiness becomes downright contagious. Everyone local knows about Showmars - and it really is as good as everybody says.

Clementina is the absolute best, always super attentive and a professional waitress. A few years ago they did away with the full service at this location but it’s back now and so is my business. Food is always prepared well and menu is a good bargain for the price!
Nice  quiet place to get away for lunch or dinner. Wonderful staff, very clean and good portions of food! Check'em out. You won't be disappointed.  :-)

Nicest Showmars I have ever been in. Service and food was great. Even had the pleasure of meeting the founder of Showmars, George Couchell. He stopped by 
our table to introduce himself and ash how our meal was.
The menu was extensive, the food was delicious and the portions were great.  We absolutely loved the place.  Service was great too!!
My daughter and I went there last night.. Wow!  Great selection of vegetarian options, and food as well as the atmosphere was just awesome. My new favorite restaurant.
GREAT FOOD !! They keep the place Very Clean and the staff and the staff are Top Shelf. You won't be disappointed.
Great atmosphere, prompt service, plenty of basil.  Would have loved getting a bit more actual meat in my bowl of pho.
Took way too long and service was decent for the food.
Very good dishes with healthy options. Comprehensive menu and good Brazilian beer on tap (choop).

Pra mim um dos melhores restaurantes de Campinas!
O atendimento é excepcional!
Os pratos são bem servidos. Variedade boa.
O pene ao Limone tem sabores bem diferentes. Entradas.boas: dedinho de tapioca, pastel de carne, croquete de carne.
As sobremesas também são ótimas!

Embora um pouco caro, o restaurante sempre tem pratos leves e excelentes para degustar com a família. Na última visita, no entanto, deixou a desejar no lanche. Não que não estivesse bom, mas os lanches ficaram abaixo dos excelentes pratos servidos por lá

Kilimanjaro, maravilhoso. No charme do Galeria ou no dinâmico Iguatemi, um espaço tranquilo e muito, muito saboroso. O linguini é fabuloso. Cada camarão. Saio de São Paulo para saborear os pratos do Kili. Um pedido ao Jorge e à Cecília, tragam de volta a polenta com brie. É coisa boa. Excelente!

Meu restaurante preferido em Campinas. A comida transita entre o simples e o sofisticado, sempre muito bem executado, utilizando ingredientes naturais de produtores locais. Conceito muito bacana. Os pratos promocionais de almoço valem muito a pena, incluindo entrada, prato principal e sobremesa por um preço bem mais baixo que o cardápio normal.

This is an amazing tree. 
Love spending time here. 
Up close, it has spooky features and people love photographing it. 
The tree got so large because it was close to the original Lily Pond and it got water from the pond for decades. 
The new Lily Pond is cement, so the tree's drinking days from it are over. 
However, this beautifully, massive wonder will be around for a long time and it is worth the time to see it. 

George Vreeland Hill

It's a pretty epic size tree with all sorts of uncommon growth features as roots dangle down to the ground and others wrap around a large bolder encased in the midsection of the tree.

It's over 100 years old and over 5 stories tall.
Cool figure tree. Preserved too. Located on Beverly Dr. near the drummer sculpture.
Very big
Nice

Service was awesome! Server was always super attentive even for refill my water. And give me tips about sauces and what to mix with them.

The food was so fresh! I really enjoyed everything overall. I went for the Restaurant week and they have a special menu with nice prices. Other than a full menu experience is a highly cost.

The only downside for me, I don't eat anything spicy. I always explained that and request nothing spicy on my dishes. I have a limited tasted for spiciness that I can handle. Nothing in my order was supposedly spicy but the sausage was. Worst part is that the sausage was the first thing I tried and after that all my broth was contaminated with the flavor. So all the rest of the items tasted similar to the sausage.

For me, sausage (separating if it's or not spicy) it's not the best option to cook on broth and I think they should know better. 

Neither the pasta nor the vegetables balls were my favorite.

Interesting concept. Great service all around. Quality of proteins was very good. My only complaint if I have one is with four people it is difficult to cook enough at once on the small grill pan on the table. Which translated into quite a long dinner.

Always have a good experience going to Melting Pots. The staff have always been very nice, helpful and friendly. The food is phenomenal, nothing like it anywhere else. It can be expensive and they could have a few more drink options, but overall it's a great place for high end dining.

The new menu items were fantastic. Melting pot continues to push the envelope and redefine what it means to be an amazing restaurant, let alone one that serves fondue. The staff was extremely professional, provided excellent recommendations and were incredibly attentive. I would definitely come here again.

Today I visited for the first time and was delighted with the service. My friend came from Puerto Rico and I mentioned it to our server and she came with a plate decorated in chocolate letters saying Welcome to Bethlehem and the Puertorican flag. That was so awesome and great customer service. The fondue was good and the ambiance.  We had a great first time, totally recommend it.

Had a pretty good evening at Cabo! There was no exaggeration when they decided to name one of their drinks the Nectar of the Gods -- easily one of the best margaritas I've ever had, by nature of the listed ingredients. The tacos were filling and had some surprising zing and zest to them. Only docked a star because the lights at the restaurant were faulty and had been flickering the entire dinner.

Best food and drinks in Blacksburg, in my opinion. Ate here all the time as a student, and try to make it back every time we visit now. You can't go wrong. Everything I've had has been delicious and fresh. The corn salsa you get with chips is awesome! I recommend the volcano shrimp and soy ginger lime shrimp tacos. Margaritas are some of the best I've had. Service is great and remarkably consistent. Some students used to complain about the prices being high but it is really very reasonable. You would pay much more for this quality of food, drinks, atmosphere, and service anywhere other than a college town. You can get 2 specialty tacos, a side, free corn salsa and chips, and a jumbo margarita for less than $20 bucks.

Great food and good drinks! Can get a bit crowded being so close to town, but the staff works it well. 

Definitely recommend Taco Tuesdays where you can get $3 tacos of really good quality!

My wife and I had great service from Bella. Bella was very patient with many questions related to food allergies. 
The food itself was yummy and reasonably priced. I feel like there is a decent variety of food, too. 
The ambience was pleasant, but is slightly grungy - it’s a college restaurant/bar with surfer decor, music, etc.
Excellent food. Tasty drinks. Reasonable prices. Hardworking and friendly staff.

I haven’t in my life eaten a tough chicken till I eat at this restaurant. The complimentary WiFi voucher that is for 45min doesn’t work but gives you an indication of how long you will wait for your food. I can not recommend this restaurant, not from point of view of food nor atmosphere
One of the best restaurants in hawassa. The place is clean, cozy, and convenient. The pizza was good also.
Great place for modern Italian restaurant service in hawassa and Arbaminch
Tasty food, both Italian and Ethiopian
A very nice restaurant with a fair price on the menu. Nevertheless, the service you get from the waitresses in not to the right standards.

Don't order from here as if you fall asleep you don't get your order or your money back so please don't order from little Italy pizza really bad review go to pizza hut as its a lot better than this place

I moved out of Aberdeen a year ago and what a loss it is not to have Little Italy around.. I simply cannot find a pizza restaurant with the same quality pizzas as this.

Expand! And for every newcomers, I highly recommend the Little Italy Calzone 12" if you like a bit spicy food!
Their sizes are a bit on the small side but otherwise great value for your money.

I went and ordered food throigh their website. The order was rejected due to them being too busy which I totally understand. However they proceeded to charge me twice and took the money out of my account. I emailed them and have not received any response. I am really not happy with this and this is slmesomet that people need to be avare off

The pizza is very good. I would say 7/10. I have tried the piri piri one and calzone. The number of ingredients in calzone is perfect. No option to order garlic sauce. Only garlic mayo available which taste very average. It is so easy to make garlic sauce, it should be a problem for the pizza place. The delivery time was shocking, 1:35, during the week. I cannot imagine waiting time during the peak times. Furthermore, the place is quite dear. It is not real Italian pizza therefore price should be lower. Why do I need to pay extra fee while ordering online through your website. I see the potential but some changes must be done.

We has a great meal!  We had a party of 6 and the restaurant accommodated us with no issues.  The separation of courses allowed us to talk and catch up without being rushed.  Everyone enjoyed the food and drinks.  The manager stopped by our table and greeted us as well.  We will definitely go back.

I had dinner at Sullivan's with another couple Saturday night and the meal and service was outstanding for everyone. I have eaten at the Sullivan's in Raleigh many times, yet this is the first time in quite a while, that I have had the opportunity to dine at this location. I highly recommend the Calamari as an appetizer. The Wedge was great, but I am a big fan of blue cheese, but simply great. The Filet was prepared exactly to my liking and was  great too. My wife ordered Sea Bass and I had a bite and it was very good and I am no much of a fish eater.

Very good food and meticulous service. If you have a gluten allergy ask them to leave the complimentary bread out when they box up your food.  I didn't know they did that and had to throw away my left over steak that I had saved for lunch the next day.  The server apparently isn't the one that boxes the food as she knew about the allergy and was very helpful.  Was unable to get a manager to call me back so I could share my experience to help the next person.

This was mine and my wife's first time eating at Sullivan's. The staff was amazing and super nice. We got the filet, asparagus and mushrooms and must say it was some of the best food I've eaten anywhere. We will definitely be going back. It was my birthday and they really provided me a top notch meal thank you.

Service at the bar was phenomenal.  Great for asking about recommended drinks and food on the menu.  Warning:  They do have a cigar lounge next to the bar, so if you do not like the smell of cigar smoke, then be cautious.

Nice venue.  Definitely worth the extra money for the covered seating, if you have lawn seats there is almost nowhere to hide it rains.  We saw Muse and before they came on there was a 90 minute delay for the rain.  The lawn folks got drenched unless they could squeeze under the awnings of the concession stands.

Loved the lay out! The food and drink was good and the bathrooms were well maintained and the concert was awesome! PNC was easy to get to and really wasn't hard to get out of after the concert was over.

I'm not sure that I could hate this venue more. The parking. How FAR it is outside of most of Charlotte. The traffic. The prices. Gosh, for such an up and coming city, it's so disappointing to have so many acts signing up to play here.

As soon as I saw I couldn't bring a chair, I decided not to go. Experienced the same at CMF in myrtle beach  . Chairs were $60.00 and sold out. If you are older and need back support and can't stand for long periods,   don't waste your money.  These places are all about the $ and not senior friendly.
Favorite big venue in Charlotte,  I've seen countless show and always enjoy it whether rain or shine

Nice and clean with sweet service. They lost a star from me because they took out the hot tub. This was a huge bummer for me since this is a ski town and there is nothing better than the hot tub after skiing all day. Also the breakfast doesn't provide a lot of gluten free and vegan options.

Stayed in a King and jacuzzi suite. Check-in took longer than usual and while standing in line the floors/ceilings must be super thin in addition to the guest staying above the main office being rude and stomping. I was worried I would have to deal with that for the night. Luckily we were given a room on the 3rd floor. The jacuzzi had a chip in it right where we were required to sit. The room had a good view and everything else went well. Overall would still recommend.

I’ve lived in Boone for about three years and stayed here for the first time tonight. The price was very reasonable and the service was outstanding! Kayla, the receptionist, was incredibly friendly while we booked our room. Love that it’s located near a couple local restaurants and a grocery store. Definitely recommend!
Clean room, friendly staff, great location. Thank you for your hospitality

We usually stay here when visiting App State. Nice, clean, close, with a helpful staff. Breakfast is decent.
The heart shaped tub in the room was hilarious! Wouldn't use it for fear off catching something!

I really loved this museum. I was wondering why a historic city like Charlotte looked so modern and lacking in individuality. I found it here! Lots to learn. Understand now that the old, historic homes came to ruin during an economic downturn. Glad to see the coverage of conflicts between police and civilians. Shocked to see some parts of the area’s racist history. Overall, an authentic experience.

The current exhibits they have are awesome. I love how one is completely focused on Charlotte history & issues we're still dealing with today (i.e. affordable housing, equal education, etc). Definitely recommend checking this museum out!

Very interesting and educational museum! I am a history nut and still had a lot to learn from these exhibits. Also lots of interactivity for kids to learn alongside their parents! Great place to spend a couple of hours without being too long or boring at all!

The museum is very nice and if you want to get to know about Charlotte and NC more then it is the best place to learn history. It’s better to plan at least 2 hours for visiting because one hour was not enough. Also museum has a nice gift shop :)
I really enjoyed my first visit surely it's not my last visit. The staff members was pleasing to everyone.

I visit both of the mint museums and this is for sure my favorite even that the other has a better outside space .
Lots of modern art, lots of local artists that is very interesting.
The children room is very well thought and little one could stay there forever if we let him . The space is divided in different areas inspired by different art pieces from the museum. There is also a art area where children can paint, do collage , do origami etc... 
In the bathrooms there is a changing tables and in the 3rd floor you can find a special room for nursing or changing also .
Park in the garage next to it , $5 only during the weekend with direct elevator to the museum .
The 3rd floor was my favorite besides the children’s room .

Nice museum, the people there were fantastic. The building felt spacious and the layout led you through the art on display in a natural way. There were many different types of art from portraits to pottery to collages. Something for anyone. It is a little pricey for a family, but worth it if you are interested in seeing ideas made real.
We were surprised and delighted by this great museum. My husband needed to go for a class, but we both really enjoyed it. They even had a few famous works of art!

Nice contemporary art and materials section.

Although I'm not big on contemporary art, I did appreciate their permanent exhibit. They also have many works of art by local artists

My daughter and I are fairly new to the Charlotte area and we visit the museum for the first time on a day trip we had a blast. It was so informative there was so much to see and it was definitely not a waste of our time or money. I would definitely recommend if you're visiting the Charlotte area or new to the Charlotte area make sure to visit this Museum.

I always enjoy my visit at the Gantt Center. Today I participated in the Heritage and History lunch and learn with Adrian Miller, a White House chef. His program was very educational and entertaining. There is always something of interest at The Gantt Center and I'm glad to have it in the heart of the city.

Amazing atmosphere, drinks were premium, and music was great... Just hate the whole idea of people not dancing at parties or clubs too much phone time, been awhile since I went out socially so I was surprised to see how much things have changed over the years... You don't pay such high $$$ for entertainment and not be human interaction in some form... Idk maybe it's just me... All-star Weekend was awesome though...
Great experience for African American culture and history. The artwork was amazing definitely gonna come back again

Beautiful galleries from artist Hank Willis Thomas! Our favorite was the video gallery. The galleries are arranged very well, especially the Brookhill gallery. The facility itself is pristine and inviting. It is family friendly, however, if your children are very young I wouldn't recommend you bring them along. This is a no touch facility with amazing work and toddlers can't help but to touch pretty things. I had to remind myself while walking the exhibits. I can't wait for the next exhibition, A Trip to the Motherland.
Dope, been here three times. The exhibits always are well put together and invoke deep thoughts about the current state of blacks in America.
Enjoyed walking through this beautiful city and enjoyed this area. So glad I came across it. The beautiful statues fill the streets and areas. So wonderful to walk around and get to the area.
Nice spot to take a moment and reflect on live life and relationships. The scenery is nice especially in the spring and summer. Perfect place for a date

Nice little park with a lot of food options. Find the Halal cart across the street and pause in the meditation garden with St. Ignatius. There's also a tiny splash park. If you eat at Fuel Pizza make sure they really heat your slice. (Fuel Pizza on Central Ave is much better, go there if you can)... Back to the park though. It's a neat little picturesque piece of Uptown. It's not a "playground"...but you can eat, walk your dog, and stretch your legs.
The green is beautiful.  Do not come in from college, use the parking deck entrance on tryon
Fantastic space. Sculptures to enjoy. Beautiful gardens and plenty of green grass on which the kiddos can roll around

Had a beautiful experience picnicking with my family on a Sunday morning. Plenty of open space, trash receptacles, and on-street parking. I can only imagine that this is a wonderful place to spend time in the spring and summer. I would definitely visit again for another picnic.
Nice small park in the middle of the city. Some TLC would make it a lot more appealing.

Who owns this park; the city, county, private? They are demolishing this park for more development, states local news. Where is the public outcry? Where are the protestors? Where are the protestors going to hold their rally's? Doesn't anyone want to save the green space? The green way? Where are local residents, who bought close to the park,  suppose to play and walk their dogs now? Does anyone want to save the trees? I read the previous buildings were demolished to create more green space. Now the greenspace is being demolished to create more buildings? What is going on? Who is in charge? Is this "world class"? Can you imagine if N.Y.C. demolished Central Park to create more buildings? Then demolished buildings to create more greenspace? They would be a laughing stock. Whoops. Is Freedom Park next? Park Road Park?

Stumbled across this park while driving through Charlotte. It was the perfect spot to take some pictures of the skyline. Very serene and peaceful too, enjoyable to walk around and be in nature for a bit.
Marshall Park is no doubt the best park in Uptown Charlotte to walk through and the pond with the water fountain is awesome to enjoy.  It's a must for everyone who is paying a visit to Charlotte.

I'll never be back. the staff needs a lesson in manners and customer service. very rude and short tempered people working here. I hope another business is moved into here, because the location is prime. sadly all the other 1 star reviews, which is mainly what this place has, is very accurate. go anywhere except here.
Small spot but great pizza. Reminds me of NY. Atmosphere will certainly take you back some years with the "antique" style decor. Cinnamon knots are a good option as well. Fairly priced lunch special.

Terrible experience!!! I called to place an order and the guy on the phone kept interrupting me and trying to guess my order before I finished saying it. It took him 5 minutes to stop talking and here me say pepperoni and sausage. I asked for 4 of the largest pizzas and I got 4 14 inch pizzas instead of 19 inch.... hours of operation are wrong online and when you call one location and order delivery it automatically reroutes you to another store without telling you which store or why. The person on the phone then gave me a different stories number and when I called and tried to place delivery it was the exact same store. She then told me that they dont do delivery and that it reroutes you to their store... that information would have been useful before you gave me the number and made me call your store again? I'm never eating fuel again! I work for a restaurant as a manager and it's just laziness and incompetence!

Bad. Really bad. We had gotten stuck in traffic and were running behind schedule. We had a 7:30 show to get to around the corner. It was 6:43.  Theoretically,  this should have been plenty of time to eat. I asked the man who took our order if the cheese pizza was ready. He said it was just coming out of the oven. Great. We pay, let the guy know we are unfortunately in a bit of a rush, and take our seat. A guy comes over 7 minutes later with pizza, takes the number off the table, then goes to another table and gives them the pizza. He never brings back our number. 15 minutes goes by and we still don't have our food. I get up to go get it. He gives me the two slices of pizza and wishes me a good night. I asked him about the garlic knots and cookies we paid for. He said oh I'll bring then over. Another 5 minutes goes by and he brings the wrong cookies. Another 5 minutes and we finally get all of our food. I think we finally got all of our food at 7:10. Almost 30 minutes to get two slices of pizza and garlic knots (which were already made and just needed to be heated up). Oh and the food was awful. The "fresh" pizza was luke warm and the cheese was falling off. The garlic knots were just bad as were the cookies that we ate during intermission. I actually felt bad for the two guys working there, because they were the only two employees in the place. One to cook, one to serve, one to take orders, and one to clean.....almost seems like two people can't do everything during dinner time.....

the worst experience I’ve ever had at a restaurant. we arrived at this location at 4:15pm, after ordering and waiting for our food we were told by an employee at 4:45pm that they “did not have cheese pizza ready” and he offered to give us a different kind or we could wait ten minutes for cheese. we decided to wait since we’d already been waiting for over 30 minutes and already paid for CHEESE pizza. about 20 minutes later we were finally served. 

the bathrooms: long story short they were unpleasant. I have been in Gas Stations better then the ones in here. My one specific complaint I will say about the bathrooms was that the height between the floor and the bottom of the stall was was too high. I felt very uncomfortable. All in all worst bathroom I have ever been in.

Excellent food and service.  Beer and wine, no liquor.  Great family atmosphere.  One of Charlotte, NC, few remaining sixty + years in business restaurants.  No words can describe what a fabulous place this is to eat, you have to experience this place on your own, just as my Grandparents did!

Man. This place is amazing. Me and my wife eat here regularly, and it is easily the best Italian food I've had. The price is great, the food is better and the service is always fast and polite. The atmosphere inside is cozy and neat. I'd eat here every day if I could, but I live over an hour away so we usually come every 2 weeks or so. It's worth the drive.
The best pizza and food in town! Nice quaint place! Laid back atmosphere! Love it!
Super cool place! Authentic Italian food for a good price. Ambience is excellent also.

As I was here with a gathering of coworkers, our orders were taken. I watched as my coworkers received their meals. I sat patiently KNOWING my food was coming with the last of the orders. THEN... I was told, one of to the other waitresses TOOK MY MEAL and gave it to SOMEONE ELSE. Now, as an A/A male, (the ONLY one in our little group), I wasn't TOO comfortable with ANY REASON for the delay. Why was that allowed to happen? 
The iced tea(starting out), was good. As the time I had to wait passed, the refills got weaker and weaker. NOT A GOOD EXPERIENCE AT ALL!
   **UPDATE**
   (Bear in mind that I got sick over that weekend).
As we went to this place on Friday 28 April 2018. I got to work Monday (30April), and was asked by our GM if I had gotten sick over the weekend(?). I'm thinking "how does he know that? Come to find out, that THREE of us ordered the same meal and... THE 3 OF US GOT SICK!!!

**ANOTHER UPDATE** 
We are headed BACK to "Open Kitchen". It's a work function and I have to at LEAST give them a chance to redeem themselves. STAY TUNED! 🙏. 🙄😉

My visit today to "Open Kitchen" was PHENOMENAL!! The service was GREAT! MY order was actually taken AND RECEIVED FIRST. Afterwards, I spoke with the manager and explained to her my last visit. Going on to let her know that THIS visit was the TOTAL OPPOSITE. I would could, I would give them MORE THAN Five Stars!! 👍👍👍👍👍👍

This place has great Irish food! I had the bangers and biscuits and it was phenomenal. I also tried the fish and chips that someone at my table ordered and that was delicious as well. The wait staff was friendly and helpful and the atmosphere felt like a real pub in Ireland! If you're I  uptown Charlotte definitely stop by and have a pint and a bite to eat!

This place is excellent! The haddock fish fry reminds me of the ones I enjoyed for 25 years in upstate New York and is worth every penny. The staff is friendly, prompt, and responsive, and the atmosphere is very earthy and subdued, reminding you of a candlelit Irish tavern. If you are in the neighborhood of this place on a Friday, you will NOT be disappointed with Rí Rá!

Exactly what you want in an Irish pub.  Good brews, good food, chill vibe, cozy dining, live music, friendly staff...  had a great time with friends.  Fish 'n' chips did not disappoint and the fried pickles were tasty.  The fudge brownie sundae was also excellent. We will definitely be back!

This was a nice find which occurred by total serendipity as I walked from a hotel to our dinner. Ducking into this place was like stepping into Ireland for a few minutes. The decore is appropriate and especially love the black and white pictures of all the Irish folks. I had a snack before dinner that was delicious and enjoyed the friendly service is well. Definitely a place I will revisit.
Went during lunch and it was pretty empty. I got the Irish Breakfast (which I've had before) and it was clutch. After a late night it was a great meal. Lots of meats on the plate. :)

Excellent staff! It was a really busy time when I went in but they were on point.
The dish i ordered was absolutely amazing.
I'll surely visit this place again.
Great food at an affordable price... Not to mention the service is phenomenally personable. We've always gotten our food 10-15 minutes after ordering.
Great salt and pepper wings.  Best I've had in Charlotte.  Definitely worth the trip.
Great place for lunch!  Excellent red beans and rice.  Good for dinner as well, but menu is limited to their "normal" fare.  But everything there is fresh and well prepared.
Best lunch in uptown. I don't know how they do it. Delicious, fast, inexpensive.
Absolutely love this restaurant! Staff was on point, friendly, knowledgeable and amazing. Thank you for this wonderful experience, I will be back soon! People....go! You won't regret it!

Class, Style and Elegance
Bentley's on 27 is an incredible restaurant with an absolutely amazing view.  When you go to Bentley's it is a truly memorable experience.  The bar area is set up First Class all the way, and it is the perfect place to wait for your table.  I'd suggest going in early before your reservation just to enjoy one of the custom cocktails.  The waiters are all white jacketed true professionals who will treat you like a VIP.  Very old school - very cool.  They have several tableside prepared dishes that will make you the envy of everyone around you.  The Chateaubriand is simply a treat from the time your Chef starts prepping it, flaming it and plating it to the last bite.  It is a perfect meal for two, and it comes with sides.  In today's world - that makes the meal a bargain.  I've been to Bentley's as part of a large group, and for an intimate dinner with my wife and everytime has been great.  I would also recommend that you ask to meet Jim the owner.  He is a joy to speak with, and he truly appreciates all of his guests.  Give Bentley's a try - you will not be disappointed.

The food was outstanding!! The waiter was only ok, slightly rude and unresponsive. The view is wonderful and we got to see someone get engaged, it was so sweet! Great place overall, but staff may need a refresher on service experience.

My wife and I shared our 49th wedding anniversary April 5th 2019 there at Bentley’s 27 , she informed me that this was the best one ever. The food was delicious, the view was excellent, team 4 made our night pleasant. Thank you very much!
Very nice dining experience. It’s at the top floor so you have a beautiful view of the city. If you want a nice upscale environment with good food and prices then this is the place to go.

This place is great!  Fun bar setting and staff, the food was beyond my expectations.  Went here for 2 year anniversary and did not regret the choice.  Diverse menu for those who don't like seafood, as well.  I will definitely return next time I'm in Charlotte.

At this place you're paying for the location, in the heart of Uptown, rather than the quality of the food.  The atmosphere is loud, the tables are crammed close together, and you get free entertainment from watching people wait for the train on the platform outside the restaurant.  The food was ok.  Our medium-rare steaks were way over-cooked and dry, the lobster tails were the same and the chef is obviously in love with his salt shaker.  For a restaurant where entrees are >$25 per, I should not be able to see into the kitchen and watch the plates come up and wait under heat lamps prior to being served.  I will say our server was very good and personable.  All in all, don't waste your money here when there are other restaurants like McCormick and Schmick's that are much classier and deliver more value for your visit.
nice flair and good service. food can vary but good specials are normally very good.
Fantastic seafood. The seabass is among the best in town.

DON'T GO!!  My family took my son here for his birthday instead of Sullivans, and even though his steak was ok (filet mignon is a regular present), the rest was sorely disappointing.  For myself, the atmosphere wasn't good and the hostess totally deflated my initial impressions before we sat down.  Then the waitress was fumbling and unprofessional.  My sea bass was excellent is about all I can say was positive.  The calimari was a mess of onion, eggplant(??), and mystery morsels - it was entertaining trying to guess what they used to fill a simple appetizer with junk.  I look for food overall, the experience (with family or friends), and the atmosphere, and 1 out of 3 doesn't get it.  And then the doltsy waitress overcharged me, and management is apparently not going to refund me after I called and they said they would.  Definitely not worth the money.  Try somewhere else in uptown CLT.
